text:
Problem with Julia 1.6.0 and previous using processes. I am using Distributed package to concurrently compute something, and when I start julia -p 20 it works ok. But I want to make a binary bundle, and than somehow default shown by julia --help "auto" launches as many workers as the number of local CPU threads (logical cores)" for -p parameter, allocates only 1 thread, so compiled binary also uses 1 thread. I think this is Julia issue not detecting correctly number of physical cores of my CPU.
I am running julia binary from website on GNU/Linux Debian x86.

text: The thing is that if I start julia without -p 20, it also uses 1 thread. It works only when I explicitly start with -p 20. But help says that it should automatically detect number of physical cores, which is not the case here.
